channel.description: Wine Spectator Online - Daily Wine Picks

item.title: Viña Caliterra Chardonnay Casablanca Valley Tribute 2006 $12 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Fresh, clean style, with a stony undertow to the peach pit, yellow apple and floral notes. Bright, clean finish is very youthful for its age. Drink now through 2009. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,200 cases made.

item.title: Hervé Bizeul & Associés Côtes du Roussillon Walden 2006 $15 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Firm and focused, showing concentrated flavors of dark plum, kirsch and beef, followed by a lithe finish of iron, mineral and spice, with plenty of dark chocolate. Drink now through 2013. 2,000 cases imported.

item.title: Drappier Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Cuvée Signature NV $49 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: A bright version, chock full of citrus, peach, pear and pastry notes. Harmonious and refined in texture, this glides to a long, nutty aftertaste. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

item.title: Domaine Ste. Michelle Extra Dry Columbia Valley NV $12 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Soft and lightly sweet, with modest pear and spice flavors, finishing with a floral edge. Drink now. 51,919 cases made.

item.title: Big House Petite Sirah Paso Robles The Prodigal Son 2005 $15 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Fragrantly floral, with a bright fruit profile of red currant, cherry and fruit punch flavors. The chewy tannins stay in the background. Drink now through 2012. 8,500 cases made.

item.title: Bethel Heights Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Cuvée 2006 $50 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Smooth and vibrant, with distinctive raspberry, white pepper and mint aromas and flavors against fine acidity. The flavors persist nicely into the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2014. 1,625 cases made.

item.title: Loel Commandaria Alasta NV $13 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Very mapley and sweet, with concentrated flavors of fig, almond butter and baked peach. The rich, lush finish is filled with spice and pastry notes. Drink now through 2015. 50,000 cases made.

item.title: Crocker & Starr Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley 2007 $28 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Focused and intense, with fleshy ripe peach, nectarine, melon and pear flavors, shaded by mineral, herb and floral notes. A refreshing acidity keeps all the intense flavors light on their feet and very juicy, with a finish that goes on forever. Drink now through 2011. 1,370 cases made.

item.title: Paitin Barbaresco Sorì Paitin 2005 $48 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Dense and concentrated, with lots of berries and cherry, with a cut wood note. Full-bodied, with chewy tannins and a mouthpuckering finish. Needs lots of time in the bottle to come around, but should be really outstanding in the end. Best after 2013. 1,200 cases imported.

item.title: J. & F. Lurton Syrah Vin de Pays d'Oc Les Bateaux 2007 $10 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Crunchy red berry flavors and spicy notes fill this juicy red, with graphite and iron on the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

item.title: Dry Creek Fumé Blanc Sonoma County 2007 $15 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Balances an elegant light body with pleasant juicy acidity and pretty notes of lemon-lime, ruby grapefruit and grassy herbal nuances that come together on the finish. Drink now. 29,908 cases made.

item.title: Paul Autard Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2006 $45 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Delivers a nice beam of raspberry, graphite and sweet earth notes, backed by a toasty, slightly firm finish. Should round out nicely with modest cellaring. Best from 2009 through 2018. 1,665 cases made.

item.title: Domaine Drouhin Pinot Noir Willamette Valley 2006 $45 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Crisp, with an open feel to the meaty cherry and blood orange flavors that persist nicely through a veil of fine tannins and linger on the refined finish. Best from 2009 through 2014. 12,500 cases made.

item.title: Line 39 Sauvignon Blanc Lake County 2007 $10 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: There's good intensity to the zingy grass, green apple and tropical notes, with bright acidity and a mouthwatering finish. Drink now. 5,084 cases made.

item.title: Pertinace Dolcetto d'Alba 2007 $15 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: A little earthy, but there's good berry and blackberry character on the nose and palate. Medium and juicy. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

item.title: Domaine Ste. Michelle Brut Columbia Valley NV $12 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: A bit coarse, but flavorful with pear, lime and balsamic aromas and flavors, lingering on the lively finish. Drink now. 191,540 cases made.

item.title: Bodegas Dios Baco Amontillado Jerez NV $20 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Round, this starts out lightly sweet, with caramel, bittersweet chocolate and walnut notes. It has good cut on the finish, with tangy iodine and smoke accents. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

item.title: Felton Road Pinot Noir Central Otago 2007 $50 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Juicy and concentrated, with fine balance to wild raspberry, blueberry and pervasive wet stone character. Sandalwood and subtle spice highlight the mineral nuances on the finish. Opens up nicely with air. Drink now through 2012. 8,000 cases made.

item.title: Château de Paraza Minervois Cuvée Spéciale 2006 $10 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: This lush red brims with red plum, raspberry and spice flavors, with silky tannins. The vibrant finish of red cherry is accented by smoky notes. Drink now through 2011. 1,000 cases imported.

item.title: Jean-Maurice Raffault Chinon Les Picasses 2006 $22 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Firm and focused, with a chalky spine adding definition to the core of black cherry and blackberry fruit. Additional olive, tobacco and spice notes fill out the finish. Well-integrated and solid depth. Drink now through 2010. 2,100 cases made.

item.title: Argyle Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve 2006 $43 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Lithe and open-textured, with a welcome transparency to the blackberry, currant and plum fruit and the shadings of star anise and black pepper. The finish sails on with minimal impediment from tannins. Drink now through 2014. 6,450 cases made.

item.title: Pedro Romero Amontillado Jerez Dry Rich NV $11 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Almost creamy, this amontillado evokes chocolate, dried fig and spice flavors. Firms up on the finish, with a smoky aftertaste. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

item.title: Paul Autard Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée La Côte Ronde 2006 $65 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Very expressive, with gorgeous aromatics and flavors, this has a racy, fruit-packed core of raspberry ganache, fig and boysenberry buttressed by dark cocoa, espresso, roasted chestnut and graphite notes. Long and intense through the finish, with fruit and minerality intertwined for the long haul. Drink from 2010 through 2023. 1,250 cases made.

item.title: Bründlmayer Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Kamptaler Terrassen 2007 $30 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Redolent of fresh-cut Pippin apple and nectarine, with lots of ripe spice and tropical fruit notes. The racy finish is quite minerally. Drink now through 2014. 5,000 cases made.

item.title: Gloria Ferrer Chardonnay Carneros 2006 $20 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Mouthwatering acidity give the lemon-citrus and green apple flavors plenty of structure. Full-bodied and tightly wound. Drink now through 2011. 11,600 cases made.

item.title: Les Accents du Vignoble Viognier Vin de Pays Vignobles de France Le Paradou 2007 $11 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Plump and forward, with tasty melon and peach fruit flavors backed by a hint of anise. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

item.title: Leonetti Merlot Columbia Valley 2006 $65 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Lean and crisp, almost delicate in its subtle, supple structure, with raspberry, blackberry, coffee and sage aromas and flavors that linger extensively and expressively on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2013. 2,723 cases made.

item.title: Domaines Listel Vin de Pays des Sables du Golfe du Lion Gris de Gris Pink Flamingo 2007 $10 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: This fresh style rosé has dried cherry and berry flavors, and the spicy finish features creamy notes. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

item.title: Stoller Pinot Noir Dundee Hills SV 2006 $40 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Soft, silky and open-textured, this shows its ripe currant and cherry fruit beautifully, shading it with hints of black olive and forest floor aromas. The finish lingers enticingly. Drink now through 2014. 1,578 cases made.

item.title: Cantine Volpi Gavi Vobis Mea 2006 $15 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Displays lemon peel, with cooked apple and pear on the nose and palate. Medium-bodied, with fresh acidity and tropical fruit. Ripe and rich. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

item.title: Bridgeview Pinot Gris Oregon Blue Moon 2007 $12 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Fresh and fruity, this dry white has juicy apricot and pear flavors, with a refreshing finish. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.

item.title: Gemtree Shiraz-Viognier McLaren Vale Bloodstone 2007 $16 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Smooth and ripe, this velvety-textured wine offers a nice spicy component to its dark berry flavors, hinting at nectarine and pepper as the finish lingers. Refined and appealing. Drink now through 2014. 8,000 cases made.

item.title: Sbragia Family Chardonnay Napa Valley Gamble Ranch Vineyard 2006 $40 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Big, rich and creamy, with toasty oak, fig, melon and a hint of butterscotch, ending with flavors that fan out in a complex manner. Drink now through 2011. 1,380 cases made.

item.title: Barossa Valley Estate Shiraz Barossa Valley E Minor 2006 $13 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Bright and lively, with juicy acidity and pretty currant and black raspberry flavors, lingering on the slightly savory finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases imported.

item.title: Bethel Heights Chardonnay Eola-Amity Hills 2006 $25 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Bright, tangy and generous with its pineapple, melon, lime and tangerine flavors, which swirl enticingly through the long, juicy finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,064 cases made.

item.title: E. Guigal Condrieu 2007 $55 (Wine Spectator)
item.description: Very juicy and still a touch compact, with green almond, fig and anise notes waiting to come out from behind the fennel and mineral. Long finish. Cellar short term to let this open up. Best from 2009 through 2011. 20,000 cases made.
